title: The Alcaraz-Sinner rivalry is one for the ages
description: On Sunday, Sinner defeated Alcaraz for the Wimbledon title -- the latest in a back-and-forth rivalry that will continue to entertain.

title: Zverev to face Popyrin in Toronto quarterfinals
description: Top-seeded Alexander Zverev led Francisco Cerundolo 6-4, 1-0 when the 14th-seeded Argentine retired because of an abdominal injury Saturday night in the National Bank Open.

title: Canadian teen Mboko topples Gauff in Montreal
description: Victoria Mboko, the 18-year-old Canadian ranked No. 85 in the world, upset top-seeded Coco Gauff 6-1, 6-4 to reach the National Bank Open quarterfinals.

title: Fritz takes out last Canadian standing in Toronto
description: Taylor Fritz cruised past Canadian Gabriel Diallo 6-4, 6-2, and fellow American Ben Shelton also advanced to the fourth round of the National Bank Open on Friday night.

title: Pegula falls in 3 sets in Montreal; Osaka advances
description: Jessica Pegula, the two-time defending champion at the National Bank Open, was upset 3-6, 6-4, 6-1 by Anastasija Sevastova, while Naomi Osaka cruised into the fourth round.

title: Djokovic, ex-F1 stars among Le Mans FC investors
description: Tennis star Novak Djokovic is part of a group of investors who have bought a stake in French second-tier football team Le Mans.

title: Top-seeded Zverev marches on at National Bank
description: Top-seeded Alexander Zverev of Germany beat Matteo Arnaldi of Italy 6-7 (5), 6-3, 6-2 on Thursday night in the third round of the National Bank Open.

title: Gauff rallies in Montreal as service issues persist
description: Coco Gauff, who survived 23 double faults in a three-set win over Danielle Collins, had 14 more double faults in a come-from-behind three-set win over Veronika Kudermetova on Thursday in the National Bank Open.

title: Remembering Arthur Ashe's historic 1975 Wimbledon title
description: Stan Smith, Richard Evans and Chris Eubanks reflect on the 50th anniversary of Arthur Ashe's Wimbledon victory.

title: A little-told-tale of Arthur Ashe, Roscoe Tanner and Jimmy Connors at Wimbledon 1975
description: Roscoe Tanner told ESPN about the advice Arthur Ashe gave him the same year Ashe went on to win -- and it didn't work.
